plugins.name: Figue
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma workflow with Figue, the AI assistant that understands design.


Analyze frames, generate text variations, create images, and receive expert UI/UX advice through natural conversations.


Whether you need fresh content ideas, design feedback, or visual assets, Figue brings the power of GPT-4o directly into your design process.


Save time, spark creativity, and solve design challenges with an AI partner that speaks your language.
plugins.tagline: Your AI design partner inside Figma, transforming UI/UX workflows through smart conversations.

133084.name: Figue
133084.description:

Save time, spark creativity, and solve design challenges with an AI partner that speaks your language.
133084.release_notes: Improvement in language management and small fixes
133084.tagline: Your AI design partner inside Figma, transforming UI/UX workflows through smart conversations.

plugins.name: Blueprint
plugins.description:
Blueprint is a UX documentation tool that helps create UX flows & development instructions lightning fast. Just import your Figma designs to Blueprint and create UX flows on its grid-based canvas.

Visit blueprintapp.design to learn more about Blueprint!


Key features:

  1. Import Figma design: Import selected frames or the entire page.
  2. Grid canvas: Arrange and organize Figma frames super fast.
  3. UX flowchart: Draw UX flows with arrows and diagrams using Figma designs, making it easier to communicate with your teammates.
  4. Add annotations: Write down instructions or detailed guidance about a selected scene for clearer communications.


To get started:

  1. Install the Plugin from the Figma Community
  2. Enter your Figma File URL
  3. Choose specific Frames or import all Frames to Blueprint
  4. Click the "Open on Blueprint" button to begin designing your UX flows
plugins.tagline: High-fidelity UX Flows Made Effortless

132111.name: Blueprint
132111.description:
Blueprint is a UX documentation tool that helps create UX flows & development instructions lightning fast. Just import your Figma designs to Blueprint and create UX flows on its grid-based canvas.

Visit blueprintapp.design to learn more about Blueprint!


Key features:

  2. Grid canvas: Arrange and organize Figma frames super fast.
  3. UX flowchart: Draw UX flows with arrows and diagrams using Figma designs, making it easier to communicate with your teammates.
  4. Add annotations: Write down instructions or detailed guidance about a selected scene for clearer communications.


To get started:

  1. Install the Plugin from the Figma Community
  2. Enter your Figma File URL
  3. Choose specific Frames or import all Frames to Blueprint
  4. Click the "Open on Blueprint" button to begin designing your UX flows

plugins.name: SheetSync For DeSo
plugins.description:
SheetSync For DeSo: Spreadsheets to Figma Design Variations


Tired of manual data entry in Figma? SheetSync For DeSo revolutionizes your workflow by letting you populate design frames directly from your data sources.

Effortlessly generate multiple design variations, product cards, user profiles, and more by connecting to:

  1. Google Sheets (Public Links)
  2. Local CSV/XLSX Files

Rename your Figma text and image layers to match your spreadsheet headers (e.g., #product_name, #image_url), select your template frame, and let SheetSync do the rest! It even includes robust image fetching with retry options.
plugins.tagline: Design at Scale, Sheet to Shape

138524.name: SheetSync For DeSo
138524.description:
SheetSync For DeSo: Spreadsheets to Figma Design Variations


Tired of manual data entry in Figma? SheetSync For DeSo revolutionizes your workflow by letting you populate design frames directly from your data sources.

Effortlessly generate multiple design variations, product cards, user profiles, and more by connecting to:

  1. Google Sheets (Public Links)
  2. Local CSV/XLSX Files

Rename your Figma text and image layers to match your spreadsheet headers (e.g., #product_name, #image_url), select your template frame, and let SheetSync do the rest! It even includes robust image fetching with retry options.
138524.tagline: Design at Scale, Sheet to Shape

plugins.name: Add Section
plugins.description:
Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

  1. Select elements (frames, rectangles, even other sections)
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Add section to put a new section around your selected elements


Resize existing sections to have the correct padding

  1. Select one or more sections
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Resize Sections to adjust all selected sections
plugins.tagline: Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

131159.name: Add Section
131159.description:
Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

  1. Select elements (frames, rectangles, even other sections)
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Add section to put a new section around your selected elements


Resize existing sections to have the correct padding

  1. Select one or more sections
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Resize Sections to adjust all selected sections
131159.release_notes:
- Added a way to fix the padding on existing sections (Resize Sections button)
- Fixed a bug where the plugin closed after each use
- Improved performance
131159.tagline: Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

plugins.name: ColourSwatch
plugins.description:
Enhance your Figma workflow with the ColourSwatch plugin


Streamline the creation, management, and updating of colour swatches using local or published Figma colour variables. This plugin provides a clear visual overview of all the colours in your project, ensuring consistency and efficiency.


With this plugin, you can easily create a ColourSwatch component. For each colour variable —whether from a local collection or a linked, published Figma library — you can generate a component instance. Use the plugin to effortlessly update values such as hex codes, alpha values, and colour variable names — one by one or as a batch for all colour swatches on the same page.
plugins.tagline: Create maintain and update colour swatches based on your Figma colour variables.

127153.name: ColourSwatch
127153.description:
Enhance your Figma workflow with the ColourSwatch plugin


Streamline the creation, management, and updating of colour swatches using local or published Figma colour variables. This plugin provides a clear visual overview of all the colours in your project, ensuring consistency and efficiency.


With this plugin, you can easily create a ColourSwatch component. For each colour variable —whether from a local collection or a linked, published Figma library — you can generate a component instance. Use the plugin to effortlessly update values such as hex codes, alpha values, and colour variable names — one by one or as a batch for all colour swatches on the same page.

networkAccess.reasoning: No network access needed for the plugin.

127153.tagline: Create maintain and update colour swatches based on your Figma colour variables.

plugins.name: Renamer
plugins.description:
Renamer — Smarter Layer Naming


A Figma plugin that keeps your layers organized by automatically generating clear, descriptive names based on their properties. Perfect for maintaining a consistent and readable file structure in complex designs.


Just select your layers and run the plugin — names will be updated instantly based on your settings.


Layer properties included:

  1. Dimensions (width × height)
  2. Fill color (HEX code)
  3. Opacity values
  4. Effects (shadows, blurs)
  5. Constraints
  6. Corner radius
  7. Stroke details
  8. Auto Layout settings

accepted.name: Pavel Grachev
accepted.description: Product designer. Focused on clarity, usability, and quality design systems.

plugins.tagline: Automatically rename layers based on design properties

plugins.name: QD - Revix - AI Feedback
plugins.description:
Get AI-Powered UI/UX Feedback Instantly! 🚀


Struggling to spot design issues? Let AI do the work! This powerful plugin analyzes your designs, provides insightful UI/UX feedback, and instantly adds comments, helping you refine your work faster and smarter.


✨ How it works:

✅ Select a design frame and start the analysis.

✅ Get multiple AI-generated feedback suggestions.

✅ Instantly add feedback as comments on your design.


Save time, improve usability, and design with confidence. all with the power of AI! 🦾🤖
plugins.tagline: AI feedback and comments on designs

plugins.name: Gename Thai
plugins.description:
Generate Random Thai Names Plugin


Quickly generate random Thai names for your designs! This plugin allows you to select one or multiple text fields and generate random names for males or females, with the option to include or exclude surnames.


❖ Generate Unique Names: Ensure each selected text field gets a distinct, random name.

❖ Customizable Gender Selection: Choose from male or female names based on your project needs.

❖ Surname Option: Add Thai surnames for a complete name experience.

❖ Easy Integration: Select your text fields, click "Generate", and watch your text change instantly!


---


สร้างชื่อไทยแบบสุ่มได้อย่างรวดเร็วสำหรับการออกแบบของคุณ! ปลั๊กอินนี้ช่วยให้คุณเลือกข้อความหนึ่งหรือหลายช่อง เพื่อสร้างชื่อสุ่มสำหรับผู้ชายหรือผู้หญิง โดยเลือกได้ว่าจะมีนามสกุลหรือไม่มี


❖ สร้างชื่อที่ไม่ซ้ำกัน: ให้ชื่อที่สุ่มออกมาไม่ซ้ำกันในแต่ละช่องข้อความที่เลือก

❖ เลือกเพศได้ตามต้องการ: สามารถเลือกชื่อสำหรับผู้ชายหรือผู้หญิงได้ตามความต้องการ

❖ ตัวเลือกนามสกุล: สามารถเพิ่มนามสกุลไทยให้กับชื่อได้

❖ การใช้งานง่าย: เลือกช่องข้อความ กด "Generate" แล้วชื่อจะถูกเปลี่ยนทันที
plugins.tagline: Generate Thai name

plugins.name: QD - Magix - AI UX Writer - Text Generator
plugins.description:
Magix - AI Text Generator enables seamless text creation for your designs using OpenAI’s API.


After connecting the API, simply select the text elements (Text objects, Sticky notes or Shapes with text) you wish to generate. The plugin will automatically list them, allowing you to input custom prompts. With a single click on ‘Generate Content’ all selected text elements will be instantly generated and integrated into your design, streamlining your workflow.


AI Makes It Simple...
plugins.tagline: AI-Powered Text Generation - All Texts with One Click

122756.name: QD - Magix - AI UX Writer - Text Generator
122756.description:
Magix - AI Text Generator enables seamless text creation for your designs using OpenAI’s API.


After connecting the API, simply select the text elements (Text objects, Sticky notes or Shapes with text) you wish to generate. The plugin will automatically list them, allowing you to input custom prompts. With a single click on ‘Generate Content’ all selected text elements will be instantly generated and integrated into your design, streamlining your workflow.


AI Makes It Simple...

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin requires access to the OpenAI API to generate text. and moeinsaboohi to load header image.

122756.release_notes:
I’m constantly working to improve Magix for a better experience. If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, feel free to share them! 😊

Version 3 Release Notes:
•  Improved UI and UX for a smoother experience
•  Fixed plugin issues in FigJam
•  Added text generation support for sticky notes and text-based shapes
•  Enhanced state message display
•  Resolved reported bugs
122756.tagline: AI-Powered Text Generation - All Texts with One Click

plugins.name: DevPlugin - Copy Disign
plugins.description:
DevPlugin is a plugin for fast migration of components.


DevPlugin automates the process of obtaining and implementing components into web projects. The plugin creates secure scripts based on the layout and allows you to use them on any external resources.


What he can do:

  1. Generating a custom JS script
  2. Personal account with subscription management and action history
  3. Data encryption and protection of user tokens


Fits:

  1. UI/UX designer
  2. Developers of landing pages and interfaces
  3. To the authors of design systems
plugins.tagline: We will help you transfer your design to the constructor with all the adaptive designs.

plugins.name: Feed Names, Get Frames (16:9, 1280x720)
plugins.description:
This plugin allows to batch-create 1280*720px (16:9) frames with user-defined names.


The frames will be created in the centre of the viewport, unless something is in the way — in this case it will place them to the bottom right of the conflicting element, and the frames created will remain selected for further batch manipulation. Frame size works well for YouTube thumbnails.


Useful for established design workflows, especially centred around YouTube design, with high volumes and short turnaround times.


Assuming that 1 manual frame creation+naming takes 5 seconds, then for 10 frames the plugin increases the efficiency by x50. And even more for a larger number of frames.

accepted.name: Alexandra (Sasha) Hunter
accepted.description: I do graphic and product design.

plugins.tagline: Paste a list of titles — get frames with those titles

125014.name: Feed Names, Get Frames (16:9, 1280x720)
125014.description:
This plugin allows to batch-create 1280*720px (16:9) frames with user-defined names.


The frames will be created in the centre of the viewport, unless something is in the way — in this case it will place them to the bottom right of the conflicting element, and the frames created will remain selected for further batch manipulation. Frame size works well for YouTube thumbnails.


Useful for established design workflows, especially centred around YouTube design, with high volumes and short turnaround times.


Assuming that 1 manual frame creation+naming takes 5 seconds, then for 10 frames the plugin increases the efficiency by x50. And even more for a larger number of frames.
125014.tagline: Paste a list of titles — get frames with those titles

plugins.name: Remove and select next
plugins.description:
😟 FIGMA NATIVE BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer triggers a global deselect.

Consequently, you need to take your mouse to select the next layer you want to work on.


🥳 PLUGIN BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer select the next layer.

Meaning you don't need to take your mouse back and you can continue to design at the speed of light on your keyboard!


⌨️ KEYBOARD SHORTCUT

Plugins can't have keyboard shortcuts so you'll have to set it on your own.

See this page for a tutorial on macOS native keyboard shortcuts and BetterTouchTools
plugins.tagline: Remove layers without leaving your keyboard

plugins.name: comodo exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you rename and export layers named $IMG in your Figma project based on special tags. You can choose between two workflows:

  1. Destructive export: Layers are renamed and export settings applied (JPG, PNG, SVG, @1x, @2x, @3x). Once renamed, the original $IMG layers are lost, and the plugin cannot be rerun unless you revert to an earlier version.
  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
plugins.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

134292.name: comodo exporter
134292.description:
This plugin helps you rename and export layers named $IMG in your Figma project based on special tags. You can choose between two workflows:

  1. Destructive export: Layers are renamed and export settings applied (JPG, PNG, SVG, @1x, @2x, @3x). Once renamed, the original $IMG layers are lost, and the plugin cannot be rerun unless you revert to an earlier version.
  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
134292.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

plugins.name: CSV to Components – Auto Layout Importer
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to import a CSV file and automatically map each cell’s text content into a predefined component from your local file or library. Whether you’re building tables, lists, or tag grids, this tool saves hours of manual work.


🔧 Key Features:

•Import and preview CSV files

•Map each cell to a selected Figma component

•Auto-detect text layers or select manually

•Preserve internal elements like icons and checkboxes

•Arrange components using Auto Layout (Grid, Vertical, or Horizontal)

•Customize horizontal and vertical spacing


Perfect for designers working with structured data, mockups, or large-scale component-based layouts.


🚫 Note: This plugin works with text-only data and supports one text field per component instance.
plugins.tagline: Easily turn your CSV data into beautifully structured Figma components.

plugins.name: Reorder Nested Instances Tool
plugins.description:
Reorder Nested Instances lets you reorder nested instances inside any Figma component instance. No detaching.


To undo a reorder, you can:

* Select the canvas and use 'Undo' (Cmd+Z / Ctrl+Z).

* Restore your file using Version History (before the plugin was applied).


Note: Support for persisting style overrides is actively being worked on - Please support this plugins development by providing feedback on the form found here.
plugins.tagline: Reorder nested instances with ease!

plugins.name: Design to System
plugins.description:
Design to System is a Figma plugin that helps you convert your existing designs into a structured design system — effortlessly.

With just a few clicks, you can extract styles from your design, register them as local styles, and reapply them consistently across your file.


Key Features

  1. 🔍 Analyze Selection : Extracts all design style properties (colors, text styles, shadows) from the selected layers. Color values are automatically categorized into background, text, and stroke styles for easier organization.
  2. 📌 Register Styles : Registers the extracted styles into your Figma local styles panel. This enables consistent reuse and supports design system creation.
  3. 🎯 Apply Styles : Applies the registered local styles back to the selected design elements — ensuring consistency and systemization.
plugins.tagline: Turn your designs into a reusable system – automatically.

136167.name: Design to System
136167.description:
Design to System is a Figma plugin that helps you convert your existing designs into a structured design system — effortlessly.

With just a few clicks, you can extract styles from your design, register them as local styles, and reapply them consistently across your file.


Key Features

  1. 🔍 Analyze Selection : Extracts all design style properties (colors, text styles, shadows) from the selected layers. Color values are automatically categorized into background, text, and stroke styles for easier organization.
  2. 📌 Register Styles : Registers the extracted styles into your Figma local styles panel. This enables consistent reuse and supports design system creation.
  3. 🎯 Apply Styles : Applies the registered local styles back to the selected design elements — ensuring consistency and systemization.
136167.tagline: Turn your designs into a reusable system – automatically.

plugins.name: JSON Frame Mapper
plugins.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field
plugins.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

137181.name: JSON Frame Mapper
137181.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin allows users to load images and data from their local development servers. Users often run local servers on common ports (3000, 4000, 5000, 8000, 8080, 9000) to serve images, SVG files, and JSON data that they want to import into their Figma designs. Localhost access enables seamless integration with local development workflows and self-hosted content.

137181.release_notes:
Now accepts and imports SVGs.

If an object {{field}} (a rectangle or square, say) is mapped to a SVG, the object will be replaced by a frame containing a group of the SVG. The SVG will be exactly the same size, shape and location (in the design) as the parent {{field}}
137181.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

plugins.name: datify
plugins.description:
Quickly update or increment dates across selected frames or text layers. It's perfect for tables, planners, and any layout where dates need to be updated regularly.


  1. Set a start date and automatically increment dates within each frame or across multiple frames
  2. Auto-detect the existing date values across selected frames
  3. Retain the original date format or choose from a list of supported formats
  4. Skip hidden layers
  5. Choose whether to increment dates continuously across all selected frames or restart within each frame
  6. Set the increment to 0 to update all date values to the same date
  7. Enter a minus sign (–) before the number to decrement the dates instead.


📅 Supported date formats:

  1. MMM D (Jan 31)
  2. D MMM YYYY (31 Jan 2025)
  3. D MMMM YYYY (31 January 2025)
  4. MMMM D, YYYY (January 31, 2025)
  5. YYYY-MM-DD (2025-01-31)
  6. DD/MM/YYYY (31/01/2025)
  7. DD-MM-YYYY (31-01-2025)
  8. D/M/YYYY (5/6/2025)
  9. M/D/YY (1/31/25)
  10. YYYY/MM/DD (2025/01/31)
  11. MMMM YYYY (January 2025)
  12. D MMM YY (31 Jan 25)
  13. D.M.YYYY (31.01.2025)
  14. YYYY. M. D (2025. 1. 31)
plugins.tagline: A quick way to update and format dates in your designs

134491.description:

plugins.name: Fast Page Selector
plugins.description:
Efficient page selection and navigation when working with files containing many pages.


Features

  1. Page Grouping: Automatically group pages using Divider pages (pages starting with `---` or containing `divider`)
  2. Select by select box: Display each group in select boxes for intuitive page selection
  3. Compact View: Hide/Show functionality to minimize plugin window and efficiently utilize workspace

plugins.name: Motionmill
plugins.description:
Prepare Your Figma File for Development with This Plugin


This Figma plugin helps you set up a well-organized and developer-friendly design file from the start. It allows you to quickly define and document your color palette and typography styles—both as Figma styles and directly within the design file.


By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes—all clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.
plugins.tagline: Colors and Typography for Motionmill

132803.name: Motionmill
132803.description:
Prepare Your Figma File for Development with This Plugin


This Figma plugin helps you set up a well-organized and developer-friendly design file from the start. It allows you to quickly define and document your color palette and typography styles—both as Figma styles and directly within the design file.


By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes—all clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.

plugins.name: Lingo
plugins.description:
Lingo helps designers and design teams scale products across multiple markets faster by streamlining localization. Effortlessly translate your designs into multiple languages — we handle conversion so you can focus on adaptation.


How to use:


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Select entire frame/specific section with content to be translated
  3. Select preferred language and translate.


Use cases:


Lingo will be useful for you or you team if you:


  1. Operate in multiple markets – Whether you're launching globally or scaling your existing products across regions, Lingo ensures seamless translation and localization.
  2. Need fast, high-quality translations – Quickly adapt marketing materials, product descriptions, and support docs without sacrificing accuracy.
  3. Work with visual content – Effortlessly translate social media graphics, posters, infographics, ads, and blog visuals while preserving design integrity.
  4. Manage multilingual blogs and articles – Localize blog posts, newsletters, and landing pages while maintaining SEO optimization.
  5. Run international ad campaigns – Adapt ad copy, video subtitles, and CTAs for different audiences with culturally relevant messaging.
  6. Collaborate with global teams – Streamline workflows by enabling real-time translation for internal documents, presentations, and training materials.
  7. Support customer experience (CX) – Provide multilingual customer service content, FAQs, and chatbots for better engagement.


Lingo helps you break language barriers efficiently, so you can focus on adaptation and growth, not conversion.


We'd love to hear from you!❤️

How are you using Lingo? What’s working well, and what could be even better? Your feedback helps us improve and serve you best—so don’t hesitate to share your thoughts, wishes, or even tiny frustrations.


Drop us a note at ajaoabdulsamad2000@gmail.com.

accepted.name: Kolade
accepted.description: Product designer - Impacting lives and businesses through elegant and delightful digital experiences

plugins.tagline: Reach every market!

  3. Work with visual content – Effortlessly translate social media graphics, posters, infographics, ads, and blog visuals while preserving design integrity.
  4. Manage multilingual blogs and articles – Localize blog posts, newsletters, and landing pages while maintaining SEO optimization.
  5. Run international ad campaigns – Adapt ad copy, video subtitles, and CTAs for different audiences with culturally relevant messaging.
  6. Collaborate with global teams – Streamline workflows by enabling real-time translation for internal documents, presentations, and training materials.

plugins.name: Designsystemet - Code syntax
plugins.description:
Dette er en tredjeparts plugin som kan generere CSS-syntax fra designsystemet. Den vil gå gjennom alle variablene som er tilgjengelig for designere i Figma og lage CSS-syntax som matcher den som designsystemet genererer.


På sikt ønsker vi at dette skal bli innebygd i den offisielle Designsystem pluginen. Men frem til den tiden så tilbyr vi denne som en workaround.


NB: Denne vil kun fungere med Designsystemets oppsett av Variabler


Github
plugins.tagline: Legg inn designsystemets CSS syntax med et klikk

plugins.name: 앱스토어 리뷰 추출기 (Appstpre Review Extractor)
plugins.description:
🧩 애플 앱스토어 리뷰를 Figma 프레임에 손쉽게 가져와 정리하세요

Easily import and organize Apple App Store reviews into your Figma frames


이 플러그인은 Apple App Store의 앱 리뷰를 가져와 평점별로 정리해줍니다.

사용자 피드백 분석, 제품 개선 준비, 인사이트 시각화 등 다양한 상황에서

실사용자 의견을 Figma 안에서 빠르고 효율적으로 표현할 수 있습니다.

→ This plugin fetches app reviews from the Apple App Store and organizes them by rating.

It's perfect for analyzing user feedback, planning improvements, and visualizing insights—all within Figma.


🔍 주요 기능 | Key Features

최근 평점별(5★, 4★ 등) 리뷰 가져오기 가능

→ Import recent reviews by rating (e.g., 5★, 4★)


현재 운영 중인 앱의 현황 확인, 고객의 pain point 확인

→ Check the current status of your app and identify user pain points


UX 리서치, 앱 디자인, 제품 문서화에 활용 가능

→ Use in UX research, app design, and product documentation


🛠 사용순서 | How to Use

1) 플러그인을 실행하세요

→ Launch the plugin


2) 사용하고자 하는 앱스토어 ID를 확인합니다

→ Find the App Store ID of your target app

(https://www.apple.com/kr/app-store/에서 앱 검색 후 주소창에 id숫자 확인/복사)

→ (Search the app on the App Store and copy the numeric id from the URL)


3) 해당 ID를 플러그인 입력창에 붙여넣습니다

→ Paste the ID into the plugin input field


4) 원하는 평점(예: 5★) 을 선택합니다

→ Select the desired rating (e.g., 5★)


5) "리뷰 불러오기" 버튼을 클릭합니다

→ Click the "Import Reviews" button

accepted.name: kenny
accepted.description: I am a designer who creates the tools and experiences that users truly need. I believe good design goes beyond visuals, flow and development.

plugins.tagline: App Store 리뷰를 한눈에, 피그마로 정리하자 (in Figma, Check your app review)

131231.release_notes: A help message has been added, and even if you don't select a frame, it will automatically generate one and input the review.A help message has been added, and even if you don't select a frame, it will automatically generate one and input the review. modify some information.

plugins.name: View Jumper
plugins.description: View Jumper helps designers quickly navigate large Figma files by creating visual bookmarks. Users set two key locations (View A and View B) that they need to reference frequently, then instantly teleport between them with preserved zoom levels and page context. Whether using the UI buttons, menu commands, or keyboard shortcuts, this plugin eliminates the frustration of constantly scrolling and searching through complex designs, making workflow significantly more efficient when comparing or referencing different areas.

accepted.name: Christopher
accepted.description:
Product Design @ heyo.is
Brand Design @ MARKoftheBRAND.com

plugins.tagline: Set viewpoints A & B. Teleport between design locations with a click.

130238.name: View Jumper

plugins.name: LocalizeBuddy
plugins.description:
🌏 Introducing LocalizeBuddy for Figma — Your Ultimate i18n Export Companion!


LocalizeBuddy automatically extracts every text layer from your Figma file and converts it into clean, structured JSON—perfectly formatted for any localization pipeline. Skip the tedious copy-and-paste: design and ship faster with truly seamless internationalization. ✨


Standout Features:


🔍 Comprehensive Text Discovery

Auto-detects every text node, even deep inside groups, components, and nested frames.


🔑 Smart Key Mapping

Auto-generate consistent, position-based keys that mirror your design hierarchy—e.g. page1.frame2.text3—so every JSON entry is predictably unique without relying on layer-name transformations.


📂 Structured JSON Output

Preserve your art-board and frame hierarchy in the output to keep context clear for translators.


🖼️ Frame-Only Export

Export the selected frame in one click—ideal for precise, frame-level JSON extraction.

accepted.name: Alvin Bellero
accepted.description: Crafting code and building dreams, one line at a time 👨🏻‍💻🤞🚀

plugins.tagline: Effortless export Figma text layers as structured JSON in one click—instantly accelerate i18n setup!

133498.release_notes:
- Now supports `Section` Node text extraction
- Replace `Export to CSV` with `Export to Excel`
133498.tagline: Effortless export Figma text layers as structured JSON in one click—instantly accelerate i18n setup!
